property_history.notes: Parents purchased working farm with farmhouse. Used as primary production and main residence.
Parents lived in farmhouse, operated cattle farm
Father passed (mother predeceased). Farm was their main residence and primary production.

property_history.description: Subdivided into: Lot 1 (farmhouse + 5ha), Lot 2-6 (5 x 9ha rural residential lots)
property_history.notes: Rezoned and subdivided - farmhouse lot retained, 5 lots for sale

properties.notes: Retained Lot 1 - farmhouse still held by beneficiaries.

property_history.notes: New CGT assets created on subdivision.
First 2 lots sold - 6 months after subdivision
Remaining 3 lots sold - 2 years after subdivision

user_query: My brother and I inherited our parents' farm when dad died in 2021. We subdivided it into 6 lots - kept the farmhouse lot and sold the other 5 as rural residential blocks. The farm was our parents' home since 1992. How is CGT calculated when we've subdivided inherited property?
